Title: Clark, Sam -- Radio Personality and Producer of the Record Black Americans
Description: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Sam Clark discuss Clark's record Black Americans, a record that addresses Blacks and the United States Bicentennial, and whether or not the Black man is still fighting the United States government.
Topics: Politics and culture; Soul music; Funk (Music); Radio personalities

Title: Greaves, William -- Independent Filmmaker and Producer of From These Roots
Description: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and William Greaves discuss how Black filmmakers during the 1960s and 1970s moved to the forefront of independent filmmakers.

Title: Maynard, Joan -- Executive Director of the Society for the Preservation of Weeksville and Bedford-Stuyvesant History
Description: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Joan Maynard discuss Weeksville, a community where freed slaves settled during the first half of the 19th Century. They also speak about the Society for the Preservation of Weeksville and Bedford-Stuyvesant History, which was initially created in order to restore three houses within the original perimeter of Weeksville.
Topics: Brooklyn (New York, N.Y.)--History; Community development;  Urban; Historic preservation

Title: Stewart, Ruth Ann -- Assistant Curator for the Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture of the New York Public Library
Description: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Ruth Ann Stewart discuss the history and collection of the New York Public Library's Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture in Harlem. They also discuss funding for a new facility since outgrowing its 135th Street location.
Topics: Public services (Libraries); Libraries--Special collections--Research; African diaspora

Title: Rhoden, John, Romare Bearden, and Larry Wilson -- A Sculptor, an Artist, and a Representative from Philip Morris, Inc.
Description: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr., artists Romare Bearden and John Rhoden, and sponsor Larry Wilson discuss the Brooklyn Museum of Art's exhibition Two Centuries of Black American Art.
Topics: African American art--Exhibitions; African American artists; Art--United States--History
Guest: Romare Bearden; John Rhoden; Larry Wilson

Title: Murray, James P. -- Film critic, Film Editor of the New York Amsterdam News, and Editor of Black Creation
Description: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and James P. Murray discuss the business aspect of the entertainment industry, including how commercialism affects the relationship between Black performing artists and business entrepreneurs.
Topics: Motion picture industry; Commercialism; Art critics

Title: Jackson Christmas, Dr. June -- Commissioner of Mental Health Services in New York City
Description: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Dr. June Jackson Christmas discuss the increase in mental health issues within the Black community following the recent economic crisis. They also discuss the programs available to the Black community to treat these issues.
Topics: Mental health; Mental health education; Public health--New York (State)--New York

Title: Walker, Jim -- Book Editor and Advertising Manager for Black Creation Magazine
Description: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Jim Walker discuss themes in contemporary Black writing and the forms of Black literature they feel are most expressive of the Black experience.
Topics: Creation (Literary, artistic, etc.); Writing; Student publications; Book editors

Title: Robeson, Paul, Jr. -- Head of the Paul Robeson Archives
Description: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Paul Robeson, Jr. discuss fundraising for and the processing of the Paul Robeson Archives, which documents Robeson's life as an actor, singer, and figure of the civil rights movement.

Title: Dempsey, Ellen, Robert Williams, and Florence Jackson -- Two Representatives from the New York City Bicentennial Corporation and the Director of Social Studies for New York City Board of Education
Description: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr., Ellen Dempsey, Robert Williams, and Florence Jackson discuss the various school and community projects prompted by the Bicentennial.
Guest: Ellen Dempsey; Robert Williams; Florence Jackson

Title: Artist, Ruth -- Interior Decorator
Description: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Ruth Artist discuss interior decorating.
Topics: Interior Design; Politics and culture; African American artists

Title: Stewart, Ellen -- La MaMa Experimental Theatre Club
Description: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Ellen Stewart discuss international theatre, including La MaMa's decision to begin touring Europe in 1965 when critics were not reviewing their shows.
Topics: Theater; Politics and culture; Experimental Theater

Title: Cooper, Jocelyn and Patricia Dempsey -- Coordinator of Foods and Nutrition of the Council Against Poverty and the Community Development Agency, and the Deputy Director of Food-Stamp Alert
Description: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr., Jocelyn Cooper, and Patricia Dempsey discuss why over a million Black individuals who are eligible for food stamps are not receiving such benefits.
Topics: Black Food Justice; Food Stamps; Nutrition; Community development;  Urban

Title: Taylor, Emory -- Director of the Harlem Opera Society
Description: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Emory Taylor discuss the history and work of the Harlem Opera Society, which was responsible for 40 performances a year, including two to three Black operas in the New York metropolitan area.

Title: Finch, Connie -- Sophomore NYU Student involved in Black Student Affairs
Description: Dr. Roscoe C. Brown, Jr. and Connie Finch discuss contemporary Black student political views and how they differ from the Black student activism of the 1960s.
Topics: Politics and culture; African American women in higher education; Student movements; Activism
